captions.text: On Thursdays in Abu Dhabi all souped-up cars head to one place:
the quarter mile. It's a playground for the ultra-rich.
Those who battle one on one and come out ahead
win one thing in particular: big props with their crew.
There's a lot going on here.
The Abu Dhabi drag strip is a must for every tuner.
Salah and Jimmy have big plans today too.
They're here to prove that their mega souped-up Mercedes
is the fastest CLS in the world.
They're out to break a record.
These guys know all the tricks.
Let's take a look inside.

No backseat, no passenger seat.
It's all been cleared out.

And from the outside it looks
like a sophisticated limousine.

But the whole interior
has been stripped.
Just like a real dragster, it has wide slicks for extra traction,
but the front wheels are another story altogether.

They're really narrow,
which reduces roll-resistance.
They pull out all the stops.
No CLS in the world has pulled off a quarter mile time
faster than 10.7 seconds.
If this car manages to break the record,
an ultra-rich client will buy it that very night.
That's how the business works here.

Awesome!
- That's incredible.

New world record!
- Go Jimmy!
The track has been covered in glue,
which greatly increases grip for the drag races.
Matthias did a little sock test to illustrate just how sticky it is.
Matthias was challenged to a race by the Speed Gang.
He's meeting them in the evening.
In the speed arena after sundown
all hell breaks loose.
Then the moment of truth.
The Speed Gang members reveal themselves.
Matthias has no idea how much power they've got under their hood.

The engine sounds here
are just incredible.
All the big names are here,

and everything
that's suited to drag racing.
The Speed Gang lays down their first trump card.
A Mercedes CLS with supposedly well over 690 horsepower.
Time to test the sparring capabilities of the SL.
This looks like my first competitor.
Hi, I'm Matthias.

Hi.
- What's your name?
I'm Sultan.

We're racing each other now?
- That's right.

And you belong to the Speed Gang?
- Yes. I've heard a lot about you.
Have you seen GRIP on the Internet?

Yes, I've seen them all.
That's why I want to kick your ass.

And you want to race?
- You bet.
Then let's do it.
No more fooling around.
Matthias might not have the experience of his rival
who races here weekly,
but he's well equipped with the mega SL in his corner.
What really matters now
is transferring the SL's power to the asphalt.
A bad start, but that's no big deal at all.
The SL makes up for it with its brutal power.
The race must be a bit of a letdown for Sultan from the Speed Gang.

Holy  moly!
Our friend with the CLS 63

didn't have
a snowball's chance in hell.

He lead for a second,
and then he totally got blown away.
Well,
if the Speed Gang challenges GRIP

then they have to take
what Malmadie dishes out.
My pleasure.
1:0 Matthias.

What happened?
- My wheels spun.

But you're in the Speed Gang.
- Yeah, but this time you were lucky.
But the Speed Gang doesn't give up that easy.
The ultra-rich boys are just getting warmed up.

Where's that Matthias guy.
I'm gonna crush him.
Here's the next guy.
This time a pimped BMW M6 lines up next to Matthias.

A M6!
What's the deal with your M6, guys?

What's the deal with your M6?
I'm losing it!
It's leaving them all in the dust.

Good thing those guys don't know
that I've got badass rear tires.
Because that's the big secret.
Traction is everything here.
And I've got some wicked grip, people.
Wicked!
2:0 Matthias.

My tires are the problem.
I had no grip.

I should've put semi slicks on
for the race.
The wheels spun the whole time.
But okay, I lost.

He challenged me
and now he's making excuses.
You sent me the email, right?

And now you're kicking all our butts.
But it's still cool that you're here.
Thank you.
The showdown.
The boss of the Speed Gang is taking things into his own hands.
That guy is nuts.
I think he's really nuts.
That Nissan GTR is a monster.
And it's got all-wheel drive. Does Matthias stand a chance?
Shit!
I started much too late.
I'm gaining! I'm gaining!
Gun it, baby!
Gun it!

That was a bad start, Matthias.
A really bad start.
A duel with an equal that was so close
that Matthias can't tell if he's won or lost.

10.9 seconds.
- Really? 10.9?
10.9 isn't bad.
Not bad at all.
The race against the Speed Gang boss was one of the fastest that night.

I was really slow on the start.
- That was a good race!

You're amazing, bro!
What an awesome race!
I missed the start.

Yeah, I noticed. I lost anyway.
Your time was good.
But it was pretty close at the end.

Yeah, come on.
It was really cool anyway.
Three races, three wins.
Matthias remains king of the Abu Dhabi dragstrip.
Luckily the Speed Gang took it well,
but they have a new plan, and lure Matthias into terrain
where he's got no experience whatsoever.

comments.author: Watermelon

comments.text:
Ich glaub nich das das ein "Standart" GT-R ist. Ich meine es wird ja vorher 
(oder in einem anderem Abu Dhabi Video) gesagt das Serien Fahrzeuge 
Fehlanzeige sind. 
Außerdem hat Nissan den GT-R nur zum Sprinten gebaut (zwar auch als 
Universal-Waffe, aber ich würd ihn nicht als Kurven-Wunder bezeichnen wie 
den Porsche 911 GT3).
AMG veredelt Alltags-Fahrzeuge und das können sie am besten muss ich sagen. 
Ihre Sportwagen haben aber lediglich Heckantrieb
(damit mein ich jetzt SL, SLS und AMG GT) das macht sie nicht zu Sprintern.
Der SL 63 AMG wird wohl erst ab 130 km/h den hintern hochkriegen weil er 
mit Heckantrieb natürlich beim Start schlechtere Karten hat.
Da ich glaube das der GT-R mindestens über 600 PS hat (und ein reinrassiger 
Sprinter ist) zieht der SL ihn logischer nach 350 m ab. Und ist dann bei 
402.3m
Schneller.
